xxl.core.xml.util
Class XPathLocation

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.xml.util.XPathLocation

public class XPathLocation
extends Object

This class represents an XPath location. It stores the information inside arrays and is very efficient.

Field Summary
protected  boolean[] ancestorFlag
          ancestorFlag[x]==true means ancestor relationship ("\\").
protected  int[] counts
          Number of a tag on a level. 0 means, that the tag count is always matched.
protected  String[] markups
          Markup Strings of the XPath expression.
protected  int matchLevel
          Stores the level, where the next matching is desired.
protected  int size
          Number of markups that are stored inside the location.

setAncestorFlagsToFalse

matchPart

public final int matchPart(String s,
                           int number)
Matches the next part of the XPath expression with the String s. Before matching the first part of an XPath expression, you should set the current matching level to 0 (especially, when you use the same XPathLocation object for multiple matches).

Parameters:
s - String to be matched.
number - Count of part to be matched. If the number is 0 then, the number is always matched.
Returns:
an integer signaling the following:
0: the next markup part could not be matched.
1: the next markup part is matched (the markup string is
equal), but the number is not matched.
-1: markup and number are matched. The match level is increased.
-2: the part could be matched due to the fact, that it is an ancestor tag.

getMatchLevel

public final int getMatchLevel()
Returns the current match level.

Returns:
the current match level.

setMatchLevel

public final void setMatchLevel(int level)
Sets the match level to the desired value.

Parameters:
level - the new match level.

isMatchingComplete

public final boolean isMatchingComplete()
Determines, if the expression is completly matched or not.

Returns:
true iff the expression is matched.

getMarkup

public final String getMarkup(int number)
Retrieves a markup part of an XPath expression.

Parameters:
number - of the markup inside the expression.
Returns:
the markup String.

getMarkupCount

public final int getMarkupCount(int number)
Retrieves the count of a markup of an XPath expression.

Parameters:
number - of the markup inside the expression.
Returns:
the count.

getAncestorFlag

public final boolean getAncestorFlag(int number)
Retrieves, if the markup with the associated number has an ancestor operator in front of itself or a normal descendant operator.

Parameters:
number - of the markup inside the expression.
Returns:
true if it is an ancestor operator, false, if it is the descendant operator.

getNumberOfParts

public final int getNumberOfParts()
Returns the number of parts inside the XPath expression. Example: /PLAY/ACT contains two parts.

Returns:
the number of parts.

setLastCount

public final void setLastCount(int number)
Sets the count of the last tag in the location.

Parameters:
number - the new count of the last tag.

append

public void append(String markup,
                   int count,
                   boolean ancestor)
Appends a new tag to the end. If the internally used arrays are to small, then new bigger arrays are allocated and the content is copied.

Parameters:
markup - the tag name of the new entry.
count - the count of the new entry.
ancestor - the ancestor flag of the new entry.

removeLast

public void removeLast()
Removes the last makup tag.

toString

public String toString()
Returns a String representation of a XPathLocation Object. For each tag, the name of the markup, the markup count and if the connection is direct is outputed.

Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
The string representation.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
Contains a simple example of the usage of XPathLocation.

Parameters:
args - Parameters are ignored.
